title: Govt ensures screening measures for metapneumovirus at airports: NA told
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 15 (APP): Parliamentary Secretary Dr. Darshan informed the National Assembly on Wednesday that comprehensive arrangements have been made to ensure the screening of metapneumovirus at all airports across the country.
Responding to a calling attention notice regarding the spread of human metapneumovirus, Dr. Darshan said that only two cases have been reported in Islamabad so far, and the government remains fully vigilant in addressing the issue.
He highlighted that trained doctors and paramedical staff are stationed at all airports to carry out screening procedures.
Dr. Darshan said that the virus primarily affects the elderly and young children. He added that hospitals have been equipped to treat affected individuals and provide isolated facilities to prevent further spread.
He assured the Assembly that no severe cases have been reported in the country. The government, he said, is also actively working to raise public awareness about the virus.
